Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.45, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. After that, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.45 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 * operation: Create a new solid body Finally, record the description of the CAD part, including its shape, length, width, and height: * Shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.45 * Height: 0.75</description>

Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with no extrusion in the direction of the normal and an extrusion depth of 0.1875 units in the opposite direction.</description>
